name: 5. GM Notes
content:
For this player version all the specific bonuses and minuses have been removed.

Additionally, for the buildings any discounts that a building gives for building other buildings has been removed.

The idea is that the characters should not have any exact idea of what everything does.

Using this method you would add these exact bonuses to the appropriate areas as the players use them.

This simulates the knowledge that the characters gain after they use this option.

Example:

After players set the taxation level for one month they see first hand what affect it has in regards to taxation (BP points gained) and the reaction of the people (Loyalty). You can now update the entry for that specific tax level with exact numbers.

The players build an Inn. They soon see that it improves the Economy and Loyalty. And additional, brings in more trade whic results in the Base value of the settlement increasing. You can now fill in the exact numbers on the Building Descriptions sheet for the Inn.

If you don't want to deal with this then by all means fill in all these figures immediately or just share the appropriate sections of the GM Version.
